txt.en: You have discovered the Erui Delta
The encampment that once stood in Galdir's Dell is now burned and unrecognizable. Wargs pad among the scorched wooden structures, and their howls linger on the breezes that sweep over the river.

The ruin of Ost Norhír stands atop the hill overlooking the river south of the Harlond, but now it is inhabited only by wildlife. When the people departed to rebuild their lives in the aftermath of the war, the beasts moved back in to make homes of their own.

The tents of the Haradrim remain at Aegollant, despite the defeat of the Black Serpent at the Battle of Pelennor Fields, but they are now home mostly to brigands and others who hold villainy in their hearts.
Explore enemy encampments and other dangerous places in Lossarnach.
The River Erui empties into the Anduin here, and avanc prowl among the reedy banks, threatening unwary travellers.

Remnants of the Morgul-host, scattered after the Battle of the Pelennor Fields, have begun to gather in alarming numbers in a camp they call 'Taustrok.' Within dank caves they burrow into the mountainside, threatening to spill over and become a threat to the nearby town of the Harlond.
Explore enemy encampments and other dangerous places in Lossarnach.
Stragglers and New Threats in Lossarnach
